alert.note: Alert for Marion (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 4:35PM EDT until August 20 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Marion County in north central Ohio... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 435 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported widespread street flooding in Marion with water rescues needed. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Rain is tapering off, but area streams and creeks will continue to rise as run off continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marion and Green Camp. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
